alert.note: Alert for Addison (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 17 at 11:52PM EDT until further notice by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Vermont... Otter Creek At Middlebury affecting Addison County. For the Otter Creek...including Center Rutland, Middlebury...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Otter Creek at Middlebury. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 PM EDT Monday the stage was 7.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 6.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 PM EDT Monday was 7.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain near a crest of 7.4 feet through early Tuesday afternoon before falling. - Flood stage is 6.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.2 feet on 04/21/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. Tuesday afternoon at 1200 PM EDT.
